description.narrative:
More than 15,000 people have been affected after rivers overflowed in Chocó Department. Heavy raining registered in the department of Chocó in February 22nd and 23rd has caused the overflow of the rivers San Juan, Iró, Condoto, Certeguí y Quito causing flooding in at least 6 municipalities including Condoto, Tadó, Certegui, Andagoya e Itsmina. The number of families affected per municipality are as follows: Itsmina 1.652, Condoto 850 HH, Andagoya 420, Tadó 350HH.1
"In the early hours of February 23, there were very heavy rains that affected five rivers in the department of Chocó, affecting six municipalities, but fortunately, there are no reports of people who have lost their lives, are missing or are injured. they are doing the analysis of damages and needs, "Eduardo José González, director of the National Unit for Disaster Risk Management (UNGRD), reported on Twitter.2
According with the preliminary reports from the National Government and the regional Red Cross the people affected by the flooding urgently need Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) and Food Security.
The UNGRD informed that in Itsmina 50% of its inhabitants have been affected by the flooding due to this disaster, the Major Office of Itsmina has made the declaration of public calamity to initiate the process of humanitarian support for the people affected by the flooding.3
The Department of Chocó is located in the North West part of the country, bordering with Panamá in the North and the Pacific Ocean on the West. It is one of the 32 Departments of Colombia.
